Title: Data Analyst, Product
Description:
About The Role

As a Product Analyst, you will have the opportunity to develop, test, launch and scale member banking experience products. Through experimentation, user behavioral analysis, sophisticated statistical and data science modeling, and dashboards development, you will surface product insights and recommendations that will increase adoption, engagement, and retention of our members.

In this role, you will work closely with product managers, user research, engineers, product & lifecycle marketing, and operational stakeholders to foster a data-driven product development culture, advise our product roadmaps, and build a deep understanding of member behavior.

The base salary offered for this role and level of experience will begin at $124,600 USD and go up to $155,800 USD. Full-time employees are also eligible for a bonus, competitive equity package, and benefits. The actual base salary offered may be higher, depending on your location, skills, qualifications, and experience.

In this role, you can expect to


Keep a pulse on performance metrics and KPIs. You will be positioned to have a view of the business, product, and member base and encouraged to understand and explain trends.
Foster a data-driven, test-and-learn culture with your passion for telling stories with data - not only surfacing insights but also presenting those insights and recommendations to encourage and inspire change.
Partner widely with product, engineering, research, and design to translate your insights to guide product development. You‚Äôll use data to help the organization understand how members are interacting with Chime and convert that to business and experience implications.
Lead experimentation by providing mentorship on how they should be run, defining success metrics and data requirements, evaluating impact, and providing strategic direction.
Advise roadmap, analysis and metric ideation, and strategic discussions with stakeholders.
Collaborate with analysts and other functions to help bridge business questions and technical (data / computational) solutions.


To thrive in this role, you have


4+ years in data-focused roles (post-internship), building analytical infrastructure and data tools that support a wide audience and facilitate decisions of trade-offs. B2C product analytics and FinTech experience preferred.
Expertise in SQL - you innately translate business questions to queries, understand the edge cases of joins, and can explore a warehouse to find data most appropriate to the problem.
Familiarity in R or python - you write reproducible code and have a tendency toward automation.
Experience leading experimentation, statistical analysis, and sophisticated measurement (e.g. causal inference) E2E to guide decision making.
Hands-on experience with BI/Visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc).
Experience building metric frameworks to understand user behaviors.
Ability to think holistically to solve business problems at hand and navigate through ambiguity.
Excellent stakeholder managements skills, with a record of working cross-functionally to achieve results.
A focus on impact - you don‚Äôt stop with just recommendations but ensure to see work through to changing the business.


A Little About Us

At Chime, we believe that everyone can achieve financial progress. We‚Äôre passionate about developing solutions and services to empower people to succeed. Every day, we start with empathy for our members and stay motivated by our desire to support them in ways that make a meaningful difference.

We created Chime‚Äîa financial technology company, not a bank*-- founded on the premise that basic banking services should be helpful, transparent, and fair. Chime helps unlock the access and ability our members need to overcome the systemic barriers that block them from moving forward. By providing members with access to liquidity, rewards, and credit building, our easy-to-use tools and intuitive platforms give members the ability to have more control over their money and to take action toward achieving their financial ambitions.

So far, we‚Äôre well-loved by our members and proud to have helped millions of people unlock financial progress, whether they started a savings account, bought their first car or home, opened a business, or went to college. Every day, we‚Äôre inspired by our members‚Äô dreams and successes, big and small.

We‚Äôre uniting everyday people to unlock their financial progress‚Äîwill you join us?


Chime partners with The Bancorp Bank and Stride Bank, N.A., Members FDIC, that power the bank accounts used by Chime Members.


What We Offer


üè¢ A thoughtful hybrid work policy that combines in-office days and trips to team and company-wide events depending on location to ensure you stay connected to your work and teammates, whether you‚Äôre local to one of our offices or remote
üíª Hybrid work perks, like UrbanSitter and Kinside for backup child, elder and/or pet care, as well as a subsidized commuter benefit
üí∞ Competitive salary based on experience
‚ú® 401k match plus great medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
üèù Generous vacation policy and company-wide Chime Days, bonus company-wide paid days off
ü´Ç 1% of your time off to support local community organizations of your choice
üëü Annual wellness stipend to use towards eligible wellness related expenses
üë∂ Up to 24 weeks of paid parental leave for birthing parents and 12 weeks of paid parental leave for non-birthing parents
üë™ Access to Maven, a family planning tool, with $15k lifetime reimbursement for egg freezing, fertility treatments, adoption, and more.
üéâ In-person and virtual events to connect with your fellow Chimers‚Äîthink cooking classes, guided meditations, music festivals, mixology classes, paint nights, etc., and delicious snack boxes, too!
üíö A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in FinTech and help millions unlock financial progress


We know that great work can‚Äôt be done without a diverse team and inclusive environment. That‚Äôs why we specifically look for individuals of varying strengths, skills, backgrounds, and ideas to join our team. We believe this gives us a competitive advantage to better serve our members and helps us all grow as Chimers and individuals.

We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. Chime is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Cook County Ordinance, and consistent with Canadian provincial and federal laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Title: Senior Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world‚Äôs largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We‚Äôre also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that‚Äôs built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun ‚Äì where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

This role will be based in NYC, SF, Sunnyvale, or Chicago.

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

As a Senior Insights Analyst in the Product Operations organization, you will leverage one of the richest proprietary data sets in the world to create compelling, impactful and actionable insights for our company, and our product and operations teams. Your expertise will help us deepen the intelligence from our member/customer signals and elevate the quality of our products.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who thrives in bringing structure to ambiguity, designing data-driven solutions, and measuring business and consumer impact. You have substantial experience with analytical tools and techniques, and bring a solid skill set in analyzing data and communicating recommendations. You combine analytical rigor, investigative skills and a growth mindset to build data driven learnings at scale.

To be successful as a Senior Insights Analyst, you need to be highly analytical and creative in turning large complex data into conclusions and be able to work with several cross-functional stakeholders and excel in relationship-building, enablement and collaboration.

Responsibilities


Leverage LinkedIn's unique data to drive insights and learnings for product improvement
Build and scale insights to help our teams deliver exceptional products and services to all members and customers
Partner closely with our Product Operations teams to turn data into action, and provide recommendations to influence and shape the product strategy and roadmap
Write SQL/Presto/Spark/Python queries to extract, blend and analyze structured and unstructured data, and present the findings in Tableau and PowerPoint
Partner and execute with Data Science, Business Intelligence, Engineering to ensure foundational data are available and accurate for Insights tools and analyses
Build analytical tools, products, and dashboards to democratize insights and enhance our collective storytelling ability
Apply statistical models and causal inference methods to uncover trends, measure impact, and predict future performance of our product
Connect signals we have from our members and customers across, including but not limited to: customer support cases, social media mentions, behavioral data on the platform, and more
Help develop the predictive analytics engine in partnership with Data Science to project the impact of friction reduction in product
Own the analytical framework, and provide methodology & measurement for new product quality metrics like user success & sentiment.
Collaborate closely with product, operations, engineering teams to provide analysis, reporting and tool-building capabilities that inform our key stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities to scale insights through automation and self-serve mechanisms
Coach and uplevel our signals and product quality teams on tools, analytics and insight



Qualifications

Basic Qualifications


5+ years experience in an analytics or quantitative role
Bachelors Degree in math, statistics, economics or related quantitative field
5+ years experience in a role requiring research, data interrogation, analysis and visualization
5+ years experience writing and optimizing SQL queries to extract trends



Preferred Qualifications


MA/MS/PhD in math, statistics, economics or related quantitative field
Experience in a role requiring influencing R&D and measuring product impact
Ability to convert a complex data set into an actionable recommendation
Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in the Technology, Product and/or Consultative industry providing actionable insights
Experience with Hadoop and/or Python for ETL, and working with big data
Experience with statistical modeling, Python/R scripts and packages
Experience with experimental design and A/B testing
Experience with Tableau, or other data visualization software
Experience with working cross-functionally with data services, engineering, product and operations teams
Knowledge of social media and consumer Internet practices

Analytics
SQL
Phyton
Program Management
